# Schedule 

- 08:25-08:30 Welcome coffee and registration[^1].

- 08:30-08:45 Hackathon instructions and Q&A.

- 08:45-14:00 Hackathon with pizza drop around 12:00.

- 14:00-14:30 Evaluation of solutions.

- 14:30-14:35 Hackathon winner announcement[^2].

- 14:35-14:40 Start of the research presentations[^3].

- 14:40-15:10 **Using Online Data to Measure Climate Change Awareness** by [*Simon Luck*](https://www.unibo.it/sitoweb/simon.luck2/en), PhD Student, University of Bologna.

- 15:10-15:40 **A Statistical Analysis of Atmospheric Ethane** by [*Marina Friedrich*](https://sites.google.com/view/mfriedrich), Assistant Professor, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.

- 15:40-16:00 Coffee break.

- 16:00-16:30 "**Energy, Economy, and Emissions: A State Space Approach to Projections**" by [*Eric Hillebrand*](https://sites.google.com/site/erichillebrand/), Professor, Aarhus University.

- 18:30 Event dinner for speakers.

[^1]: Hackathon participants are welcome to join later during the day. Instructions will be posted at the event website and the organizers will be available to answer any questions.

[^2]: Prizes will be awarded to the best solutions. 

[^3]: The research presentations are aimed at a general audience. *No previous experience on the topics is needed*. Presentations are 25 minutes + 5 minutes for questions.
